characters: PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY."

dialogues.text: Lake and Mountains.  CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD past island in lake.

dialogues.text: High Angle V.W. Car moving along road - CAMERA TILTS UP w it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. COLORADO MOUNTAINS & ROAD - DAY - L.S. Mountains and Road - V.W. Car moves away along road - CAM TRACKS after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L.S.  V.W. Car moving away along road - CAMERA TRACKS aft it and passes car - TRACKING FORWARD to Mountains in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.L.S. High Angle V.W. Car moves away along road - CAMERA TILTS UP with it.  Car goes into tunnel and comes out oth side.  CAMERA TRACKS after car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L.S.  V.W. Car moves along road.  CAMERA TRACKS after it. Mountains in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L.S. High Angle V.W. Car moving away along road.  Mountai in b.g.  CAMERA TRACKS after car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L.S. Mountain - CAMERA TRACKS IN on Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black Frames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack walks L-R across Lobby.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK & PA him to RECEPTIONIST behind desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I've got an appointment with Mr. Ullman.  My name is Jack Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His office is the first door on the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. JACK moves away R-L.  CAMERA PANS with him and TRACKS IN after him through Secretary's office to open door of ULLM office - revealing ULLMAN seated at desk with SECRETARY standing beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ullman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jack Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well - come on in Jack. ULLMAN stands up and hands book to SECRETARY, walking rou side of desk.  JACK moves into office.  CAMERA TRACKS IN after him.  He shakes hands with ULLMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Mr. Ullman. ULLMAN points to SECRETARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my secretary, Susie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie, how do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have any trouble finding us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no problem at all.  I made the trip in three and a half hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's very good time, very good.  Please sit down a minute. ULLMAN points to chair cam.R.  JACK sits cam.R.f.g.  ULLM walks behind desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAck, just make yourself at home. Would you like some coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you are going to have some, I wouldn't mind.  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and would you ask Bill Watson to join us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I will. ULLMAN sits behind desk.  SUSIE walks forward to R.f.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apartment Building - cars parked in front of it.  Mountai in b.g.  CAMERA TRACKS IN on Apartment Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. JACK & WENDY'S APARTMENT IN BOULDER (USA) / LIVI ROOM - DAY - M.L.S. DANNY is sitting at table eating a sandwich.  WENDY sitti cam.R reading book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really want to go and live in that hotel for the winter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Danny, it will be lots of fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess so.  Anyway, there's hardly anybody to play with around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.  It always takes a little time to make new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DANNY eating sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Tony?  He's looking forward to the hotel, I bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DANNY while eating sandwich wiggles forefinger of hi L.hand and speaks with different voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO, I ain't Mrs. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, Tony.  Don't be silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DANNY wiggles forefinger of L.hand and speaks with different voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go there, Mrs. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how come you don't want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DANNY wiggles forefinger of L.hand and speaks with different voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's just wait and see. We're all gonna have a real good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK over ULLMAN seated at desk.  BILL WATSON enter offic JACK rises and shakes hands with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, I'd like you to meet Jack Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, how do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab a chair Bill, and join in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATSON & JACK sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is going to take care of the Overlook for this winter.  I would like you to take him around the place as soon as we are through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is a schoolteacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh - formerly a school-teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What line of work are you in now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a writer um... Teaching has been more or less a way of making ends meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this ought to be quite a change for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm looking for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our people in Denver recommended Jack very highly, and, for once, I agree with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see, where were we?  Yes.  I was about to explain that eh... our season here runs from oh May 15th to October 30th and then we close down completely until the following May.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I ask why you do that?  It seems to me that the skiing up here would be fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it sure would be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but the problem is the enormous cost it would be to keep the road to the Sidewinder open.  It's a... It's a 25 mile stretch of road - gets an average of 20 feet of snow during the winter, and there's just no way to make it economically feasible to keep it clear.  When the place was built in 1907, there was very little interest in winter sports, and this site was chosen for its seclusion and scenic beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.L.S. ULLMAN over WATSON & JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's certainly got plenty of that. JACK laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  And did they give you any idea in Denver about what the job entails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only in a very general way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the winters can be fantastically cruel, and the basic idea is to...to cope with the very costly damage and depreciation which can occur.  And this consists mainly of running the boiler, heating different parts of the hotel on a daily rotating basis, repairing damage as it occurs and doing repairs, so that the elements can't get a foothold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that sounds fine to me. ULLMAN grunts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Physically, it's not a very demanding job.  The only thing that can get a bit trying up here during the winter is eh... the tremendous sense of isolation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that just happens to be exactly what I'm looking for.  I'm eh... I'm outlining a new writing project, and eh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: five months of peace is just what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very good Jack, because eh... for some people eh solitude and isolation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: can of itself be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about your wife and son?  How do you think they'll take to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, before I turn you over to Bill, there is one other thing I think we should talk about.  I don't want to sound melodramatic, but it is something that's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: been known to give a few people second thoughts about the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose they eh told you anything in Denver about the tragedy we had up here during the winter of 1970?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe they did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, my predecessor in this job

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hired a man named Charles Grady, as the winter caretaker.  He came up here with his wife and two little girls of about eight or ten.  And he had a good employment record, good references and from what I've been told, I mean, he seemed like a completely normal individual.  But at some point during the winter, he must have suffered some kind of a complete mental breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ran amok and eh... killed his family with an axe,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stacked them neatly in one of the rooms in the West Wing, and then he um... then he put eh both barrels of his shotgun in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. ULLMAN sitting behind desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police eh... they thought that it was what the old-timers used to call cabin-fever, a kind of claustrophobic reaction which can occur when people are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shut in together over long periods of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that is eh quite a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. ULLMAN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.  Oh, it's still hard for me to believe that it actually happened here, but it did and eh... I think you can appreciate why I wanted to tell you about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I certainly can, and eh... I also understand why your people in Denver left it for you to tell me. JACK laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.S. ULLMAN laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, obviously some people can be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: put off by the idea of staying alone in a place where something like that actually happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you can rest assured Mr. Ullman, that's not going to happen with me, and eg as far as my wife is concerned, I am sure she'll be absolutely fascinated when I tell her about it.  She's a confirmed ghost story and horror film addict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting through open door - DANNY standing on stool at b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, do you think Daddy will get the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he did.  He's gonna phone Wendy up in a few minutes to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY back to camera washing dishes at sink.  PHONE RINGS OFF.  She dries her hand and puts carton in fridge.  Then moves L-R into Living Room - CAMERA PANS with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up telephone receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK leaning on counter at reception desk, speaking into phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, hon.  How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Look, I'm at the hotel and I still have an awful lot to go through.  I don't think I can get home before nine or ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY sitting on back of chair phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you got the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK leaning on reception desk with phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right it's a beautiful place.  You and Danny are gonna love it. INT. BOULDER APARTMENT/BATHROOM - DAY - M.S. DANNY standing on stool by basin.  He is reflected in mir CAMERA TRACKS IN on his reflection in mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony, why don't you want to go to the hotel? DANNY wiggles forefinger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do too know, now come on tell me. DANNY wiggles forefinger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... DANNY wiggles forefinger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Tony, tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting towards doors of lifts.  Blood gushes in from L.side of lift and in from corridors L. and R. of lift doors - surging towards camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Little GRADY girls holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood gushing in from corridors L-R of lift doors and surging towards camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood gushing in from corridors L-R of lift doors and surging forward.  The blood gushes up into camera lens causing black out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now hold your eyes still so that I can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR bending over DANNY lying on top of his bed.  She i examining his eyes.  WENDY standing at foot of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good, now the other one. Good boy. DOCTOR straightens up.  She puts instrument away in case closes it.  Then she sits on bed beside DANNY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Danny, when you were brushing your teeth, do you remember if you smelled anything funny, or saw any bright flashing lights, or anything at all strange?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember when you were brushing your teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DOCTOR sitting on bed beside DANNY.  WENDY standing foot of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the next thing you remember after you were brushing your teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy saying, 'Wake up, wake up, wake up Danny, wake up.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DOCTOR sitting on bed beside DANNY.  WENDY standing foot of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Danny, can you remember what you were doing just before you started brushing your teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talking to Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Tony one of your animals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's the little boy that lives in my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony is his imaginary friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if you were to open your mouth now, could I see Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he hides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To my stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Tony ever tell you to do things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about Tony anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DOCTOR sitting on bed beside DANNY.  She pats his le and stands up.  WENDY at foot of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  That's fine.  All right Danny. DOCTOR puts case and stethoscope in her shoulder bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm going to ask you to do me a favor, and stay quietly in bed for the rest of the day.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'd like you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just going to go into one of the other rooms for a few minutes and talk - then I'll come back and check on you, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye. WENDY & DOCTOR move R-L to open door.  DOCTOR goes in corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR standing in corridor.  WENDY moves out of DANNY's room and closes the door.  She turns to DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we go into the living room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR & WENDY walk forward along the corridor - CAME TRACKS BACK before them and PANS R-L with them to Living Room.  WENDY points to sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. DOCTOR moves to sofa and sits down - WENDY sits in chair cam.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Torrance, I don't think you have anything to worry about.  I'm quite sure there is nothing physically wrong with Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.  Oh, yeah, he seems absolutely fine now, but you should have seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DOCTOR over WENDY.  DOCTOR leans back on sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I know.  Kids can scare you to death, but believe me these episodes are not at all uncommon, and they look much worse than they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY over DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But eh what was the matter with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Torrance, most of the time these episodes with kids are never explained.  They are brought on by emotional factors, and they rarely occur again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're more akin to auto-hypnosis, a kind of self induced trance.  If it re-occurs which I doubt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY takes cigarette out of packet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you can always think about having some tests done. WENDY holds cigarette packet out towards DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you. She puts packet down on table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm...I'm sure you're right. She lights cigarette from lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been in Boulder long, Mrs. Torrance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only about three months.  Eh we're from Vermont.  My husband was teaching school there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the appearance of Danny's imaginary friend...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY over DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Tony's first appearance happen to coincide with your arrival here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, um let's see I guess Danny started talkin to Tony about the time we put him into nursery school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DOCTOR over WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he adjust well to school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. WENDY - she shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He didn't like it too much at first, and then he had an injury, so we kept him out for a while, and, yeah, I...I guess that's about the time when I first noticed that he was talking to Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DOCTOR over WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of injury did he have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah he dislocated his shoulder. WENDY inhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he manage to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's just one of those things. You know... purely an accident, um. My husband had oh... been drinking, and he came home about three hours late, so he wasn't exactly in the greatest mood that night.  And well Danny had scattered some of his school papers all over the room... and my husband grabbed his arm, you know, and pulled him away from them. It's...it's just the sort of thing you do a hundred times with a child - you know, in a park or on the streets - but on this particular occasion my husband just... used too much strength and he injured Danny's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, something good did come out of it all because he said:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wendy, I'm never gonna touch another drop and if I do you can leave me", and he didn't and he hasn't had any alcohol in eh five months.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK FRAMES.
dialogues.text: Superimposed Title over: CLOSING DAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High Angle Trees on side of Mountain - CAMERA TRACKS FORW over them to Jack's car moving away along road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY sitting beside JACK as he drives along Mountain Roa DANNY, between them, is leaning on backs of their seats. WENDY yawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, we must be really high up. The air feels so different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you should have eaten your breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get something as soon as we get to the hotel, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wasn't it around here that the Donner party got snowbound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that was farther west in the Sierras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the Donner party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were a party of settlers in the covered wagon times.  They got snowbound one winter in the mountains.  They had to resort to cannabilism in order to stay alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean they ate each other up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had to, in order to survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Mom.  I know all about cannabilism, I saw it on T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, it's okay.  He saw it all on the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High Angle JACK's car moving away along road on side of mountain - CAMERA TRACKS after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars parked in front of Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man cleaning floor.  CAMERA TRACKS L-R.  WATSON & ULL walk forward from b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time does the plane leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that still gives up plenty of time to go over everything first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Girls carrying luggage enter cam.R and walk away to b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye Mr. Ullman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye. ULLMAN & WATSON walk L-R to JACK sitting in chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning Jack.  I hope you haven't been waiting too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.  In fact we had time to grab a bite to eat. JACK stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Glad you made it before they shut down the kitchen.  Is your family having a look around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my son's discovered the games room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Has your luggage been brought in? JACK points to luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fine.  Well in view of all the ground that we to cover today, I suggest we go and have a quick look at your apartment and then get started straight away. ULLMAN turns to WATSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, would you have the Torrances' things brought in their apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATSON walks out cam.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better collect my family first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... ULLMAN laughs and they move out cam.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ULLMAN, followed by WENDY, JACK & WATSON, moves out o cam.R.  They walk R-L across Lounge.  CAMERA TRACKS with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our Colorado Lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's beautiful. (to Jack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, this place is fantastic, isn't it hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I've never seen anything like this before.  Are all of these Indian designs authentic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I believe they are based mainly on Navajo and Apache motifs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well they're really gorgeous. As a matter of fact this is probably the most gorgeous hotel I've ever seen. ULLMAN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh this old place has had an illustrious past.  In its heyday it was one of the stopping places for the jet set, They reach corner and turn, walking towards camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: even before anybody knew what a jet set was.  We've had four presidents who stayed here, lots of movie stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royalty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the best people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY throwing darts - CAMERA TRACKS BACK & PANS L-R him as he walks to the dartboard.  He climbs up on chair pulls two darts out.  He looks cam.L.  CAMERA ZOOMS IN on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Two GRADY girls, holding hands, standing near open d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S.  Two GRADY girls, holding hands.  They look at one another, then turn and exit out through open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ULLMAN leads WENDY & JACK forward along corridor to Caretaker's Apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the staff wing of the hotel. None of the other bedrooms are heated during the winter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Two Girls carrying bags enter from cam.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye Mr. Ullman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye girls. ULLMAN waves to Girls and moves cam.R into JACK's apartme WENDY & JACK follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here are your quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ULLMAN, followed by WENDY and JACK, move up steps.  ULLMA points to open door cam.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Living Room, bedroom, bathroom, and a small bedroom for your son. JACK leans forward and looks in small bedroom cam.L.  He turns and looks cam.R. at ULLMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect for a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They move into apartment.  JACK & WENDY move away thr living room into bedroom - CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD after th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well the place is very nicely self- contained, easy to keep. JACK feels bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosy. JACK & WENDY move away and enter bathroom - CAMERA TR after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, very cosy for a family, and if you feel like spreading out you have the rest of the hotel to move around in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's very... homely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ULLMAN leading WENDY, JACK & WATSON R-L along outside Maze.  CAMERA TRACKS & PANS with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our famous hedge maze. It's quite an attraction around here.  The walls are thirteen feet high and the hedges are about as old as the hotel itself.  It's a lot of fun, They walk from end of Maze towards Hotel in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but I wouldn't go in there unless I had an hour to spare to find my way out. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the Overlook built?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.L.S. ULLMAN leads WENDY, JACK & WATSON L-R along fr Hotel - CAMERA TRACKS with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... construction started in 1907. It was finished in 1909.  The site is supposed to be located on an Indian burial ground, and I believe they actually had to repel a few Indian attacks as they were building it. ULLMAN points to red Snowcat at entrance of garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our Snowcat.  Can you both drive a car? JACK & WENDY (together)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They walk towards SNOWCAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine because basically the Snowcat operates very much like a car and it won't take you long to get the hang of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ULLMAN, JACK, WATSON & WENDY walk forward along corri CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact we eh... brought a decorator in from Chicago just last year to refurbish this part of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well he sure did a beautiful job. Pink and gold are my favorite colors. ULLMAN leads WENDY, JACK & WATSON L-R into Gold Ballr CAMERA TRACKS with them.  Men in b.g. cleaning Ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...well this is our gold ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'll say. ULLMAN leads them L-R across Ballroom to closed bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can accommodate up to three hundred people here very comfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I bet you we could really have a good party in this room, huh hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you're not going to do too well here unless you've brought your own supplies.  We always remove all the booze from the premises when we shut down: He points to shuttered bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: that reduces the insurance that we normally have to carry. DICK HALLORAN walks forward from b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't drink. ULLMAN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, you're in luck. ULLMAN waves to HALLORAN/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Dick, come on over and say hello to Mr. and Mrs. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Dick Halloran, our Head Chef. JACK shakes hands with DICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Halloran, I'm Jack, and this is my wife, Winifred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to meet you, Jack. HALLORAN shakes hands with WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to meet you, Winifred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Torrances are going to take care of the Overlook for us this winter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's just great.  How do you folks like our hotel so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's just wonderful. WENDY waves out cam.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Danny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSIE holding DANNY's hand.  They walk L-R across Ballroo CAMERA TRACKS with them to JACK, HALLORAN, WATSON, WENDY ULLMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found him outside looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, did you get tired (IN SHOT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of bombing the universe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, come on over here. DANNY walks L-R from SUSIE to WENDY.  WENDY looks at SUSI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Susie. SUSIE exits cam.L.  ULLMAN turns to HALLORAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick, if you're ready to do it now, I think it would be a good idea if you could show Mrs. Torrance the kitchen, while I continue on with Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be a pleasure.  Right this way Mrs. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  See you later, hon. HALLORAN walks away to b.g.  WENDY & DANNY follow him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye darling. ULLMAN, JACK & WATSON move out cam.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY holding DANNY's hand walks forward into kitchen wit HALLORAN.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Torrance, your husband introduced you as Winifred.  Now are you a Winnie or a Freddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Wendy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Wendy.  That's nice.  That's the prettiest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God.  This is the kitchen, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is it.  How do you like it, Danny?  Is it big enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's the biggest place I've ever seen. HALLORAN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  This whole place is such an enormous maze, I feel I'll have to leave a trail of breadcrumbs every time I come in. HALLORAN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let it get you down Mrs. Torrance - it's big but it still ain't nothing but a kitchen... a lot of the stuff you'll never have to touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know what to do with it if I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well one thing for sure, you don't have to worry about food because you folks could eat up here a whole year and never have the same menu twice. HALLORAN points to cam.L and leans to cam.L taking hold o door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now right here is our walk-in freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN opens door and steps into freezer.  WENDY & stand in doorway.  HALLORAN points to various items.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this is where we keep all of out meat.  You got fifteen rib roasts - thirty ten pound bags of hamburgers.  You got twelve- turkeys, two dozen pork roasts and twenty legs of lamb. (to Danny)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like lamb, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't?  Well what's your favorite food then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French Fries and Ketchup. HALLORAN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I think we can manage that too, Doc.  Come along now.  Watch your step. HALLORAN points to step by door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY & WENDY, followed by HALLORAN, come out of Free

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Halloran, HALLORAN closes the door and turns to WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: how did you know we called him 'Doc'? HALLORAN, DANNY & WENDY walk forward - CAMERA TRACKS with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beg pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc.  You called Danny 'Doc' twice just now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  We call him Doc sometimes, you know, like in the Bugs Bunny cartoons.  But how did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I guess I probably heard you call him that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's possible, but I honestly don't remember calling him that since we've been with you. They all stop walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well anyway, he looks like a Doc, doesn't he? HALLORAN bends down to DANNY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clicks his tongue)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me ah - what's up, Doc? HALLORAN laughs and turns away to door cam.L.  He opens d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this is the storeroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN moves forward into Storeroom, followed by DANNY WENDY.  Groceries stacked on shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here, Mrs. Torrance, is where we keep all the dried goods and the canned goods.  We got canned fruits and vegetables; canned fish and meats; hot and cold cereals. HALLORAN & WENDY move L-R - CAMERA TRACKS with them p shelf in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Post Toasties, Cornflakes, Sugar Puffs, Rice Krispies, Oatmeal, Wheatina and Cream of Wheat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. DANNY standing by cardboard boxes.  CAMERA TRACKS IN him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a dozen jugs of black molasses, we got sixty boxes of dried milk, thirty twelve pound bags of sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. HALLORAN talks inaudibly to WENDY, back to camera. CAMERA TRACKS IN on HALLORAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thought transfer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you like some ice cream, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sociables, finger rolls and seven kinds of what-have-you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. HALLORAN & WENDY move R-L to DANNY by open door. CAMERA TRACKS with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we got dried peaches, dried apricots, dried raisins and dried prunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN, followed by WENDY & DANNY move out of Store cam.R.f.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Mrs. Torrance, you gotta keep regular, if you want to be happy. HALLORAN laughs as he closes Storeroom door.  JACK, ULLMA WATSON walk forward from b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you getting on? HALLORAN & WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick, can we borrow Mrs. Torrance for a few minutes?  We're on our way through to the basement - I promise we won't keep her very long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, Mr. Ullman.  I was just getting to the ice cream. HALLORAN leans down to DANNY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like ice cream, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. HALLORAN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you did. HALLORAN straightens up and looks at JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You folks don't mind if I give Danny some ice cream, while we're waiting for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound good to you, Danny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  You behave yourself. HALLORAN takes hold of DANNY's hand as ULLMAN, JACK, WEND WATSON move away to b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what kind of ice cream do you like Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chocolate it shall be.  Come on son. HALLORAN & DANNY move out cam.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ULLMAN, JACK & WENDY - followed by WATSON - move forw CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing how much activity is going on today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well the guests and some of the staff left yesterday, but the last day is always very hectic - everybody wants to be on their way as early as possible. They turn corner and walk away along corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By five o'clock tonight, you'll never know anybody was ever here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like a ghost ship, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN looking down cam.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how I knew your name was Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. DANNY over HALLORAN - DANNY looking at HALLORAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm talking about, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. DANNY over HALLORAN.  DANNY looking at HALLORAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can remember when I was a little boy, my grandmother and I could hold conversations entirely without ever opening our mouths.  She called it shining,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and for a long time I thought it was just the two of us that had the shine to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like you probably thought you was the only one.  But there are other folks, though mostly they don't know it, or don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been able to do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. HALLORAN & DANNY sitting at table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says you ain't supposed to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony's the little boy who lives in my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Tony the one that tells you things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he tell you things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. HALLORAN & DANNY sitting at table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like I go to sleep, and he shows me things but when I wake up, I can't remember everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your Mum and Dad know about Tony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they know he tell you things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Tony ever told you anything about this place?  About the Overlook Hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. DANNY over HALLORAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now think real hard, Doc.  Think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. DANNY over HALLORAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he showed me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to think what it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. DANNY over HALLORAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Halloran, are you scared of this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Shooting across table onto HALLORAN & DANNY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm scared of nothing here. It's just that you know some places are like people, some shine and some don't.  I guess you could say the Overlook Hotel here has something about it that's like shining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something bad here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know Doc, when something happens it can leave a trace of itself behind... say like is someone burns toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe things that happened... leave other kinds of traces behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not things that anyone can notice, but things that people who shine can see.  Just like they can see things that haven't happened yet. Well, sometimes they can see things that happened a long time ago... I think a lot of things happened right here in this particular hotel - over the years, and not all of them was good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Room 237?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room 237?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're scared of Room 237, ain'tcha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I ain't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Halloran, what is in Room 237?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  There ain't nothing in Room 237, but you ain't got no business going in there anyway, so stay out!  You understand, stay out!

dialogues.speaker: BLACK FRAMES.
dialogues.text: Superimposition over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hotel.  Mountain in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY pushing trolley forward along corridor.  CAMERA TRA BACK with her.  She turns to cam.L and enters Lobby.  CAM TRACKS R-L with her across lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HOTEL - KITCHEN & LOUNGE - DAY - M.S. DANNY sitting on tricycle.  He pedals out of Kitchen into Lounge, across it and back into Kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY enters cam.L pushing trolley.  She pushes it forwar along corridor.  CAMERA PANS L-R with her to door of thei Apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK asleep in bed, reflected in mirror.  CAMERA TRACKS B WENDY enters cam.R carrying tray.  She walks forward. CAMERA TRACKS BACK with her.  She puts tray down on table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Morning, hon.  Your breakfast is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about eleven thirty. CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD to JACK & WENDY reflected in mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven thirty - Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we've been staying up too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it. JACK sticks his tongue out.  WENDY picks up plate and gla of orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made 'em just the way you like 'em, sunny side up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm, nice. WENDY walks forward to JACK and puts plate down cam.L.  S hands him glass of orange juice and he drinks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really pretty outside.  How about taking me for a walk after you've finished your breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I suppose I oughta try to do some writing first. He puts empty glass down cam.L and picks up plate of eggs and bacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any ideas yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of ideas.  No good ones. WENDY sits down cam.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, something'll come.  It's just a matter of settling back into the habit of writing every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... that's all it is. JACK starts to eat bacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really nice up here, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it.  I really do.  I've never been this happy, or comfortable anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It's amazing how fast you get used to such a big place.  I tell you, when we first came up here, I thought it was kinda scarey. WENDY laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK over WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell in love with it right away. When I came up here from my interview, it was as though I had been here before.  We...we all have moments of deja vu, but this was ridiculous.  It was almost as though I knew what was going to be around every corner.  Ooohhhhh... WENDY laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typewriter with sheet of paper in it.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK and TILTS UP onto JACK throwing ball against wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK back to camera throwing ball against wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY running after DANNY from Hotel to Maze - CAMERA PAN L-R & TRACKS with them to entrance to Maze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The loser has to keep American clean, how's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're gonna lose.  And I'm gonna get you - you betta run fast! Look out - I'm coming in close. All right? DANNY & WENDY run into Maze.  CAMERA TRACKS L-R onto Maze on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to keep America clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY & WENDY walking forward in Maze - CAMERA TRACKS before them.

dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY holding DANNY in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this to him, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch!  You did this to him, He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: didn't you? He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY with DANNY in her arms moves backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you?  How could you? She turns and runs away to entrance in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK.  He lowers his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK enters cam.L in b.g. and walks forward.  CAMERA TRAC BACK before him.  He mutters and flings his arms about. stops and looks at notice on trestle - "THE GOLD ROOM." J moves L-R into entrance of Ballroom.  He reaches out cam. and switches on lights - then moves away to lit bar in b.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK walks L-R across Ballroom - CAMERA TRACKS & PANS him to bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.L.S. JACK leans over counter and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I'd give anything for a drink? JACK sits down and puts his hands up to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goddam soul, just a glass of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK with his hands up to his face.  He lowers his hands and looks - he lowers hands to bar and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Lloyd. JACK looks cam.R then back at camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little slow tonight, isn't it? JACK laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. LLOYD standing behind bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is, Mr. Torrance. LLOYD moves forward - CAMERA TRACKS BACK revealing JACK seated at bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm awfully glad you asked me that, Lloyd, because I just happen to have two twenties and two tens right here in my wallet.  I was afraid they were going to be there until next April.  So here's what: you slip me a bottle of Bourbon, a glass and some ice.  You can do that, can't you, Lloyd?  You're not to busy, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.  I'm not busy at all. LLOYD turns away to bottles of shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man. LLOYD turns with bottle and glass to counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You set them up, and I'll knock them back, Lloyd, one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK sitting at bar.  LLOYD puts bottle and glass do on bar.  LLOYD puts ice in glass and fills it from bottle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White man's burden, Lloyd my man. White man's burden. JACK looks at his wallet then at LLOYD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Lloyd, it seems I'm temporarily light. JACK laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's my credit in this joint anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your credit's fine, Mr. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's swell.  I like you, Lloyd. I always liked you.  You were always the best of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best goddamned bartender from Timbuctoo to Portland Maine - Portland Oregon for that matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for saying so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK looks at his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to five miserable months on the wagon and all the irreparable harm that it's caused me. He drinks and lowers his glass - then looks at LLOYD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK sitting at bar.  LLOYD behind bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are things going, Mr. Torrance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things could be better, Lloyd. Things could be a whole lot better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it's nothing serious. JACK taps on bar and LLOYD fills up his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothing serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little problem with the... old sperm bank upstairs. JACK laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing that I can't handle though, Lloyd.  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women!  Can't live with 'em.  Can't live without 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  He points finger at LLOYD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Words of wisdom, Lloyd.  Words of wisdom. JACK drinks - then swirls drink round in glass, putting glass down on counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't laid a hand on him. Goddam it, I didn't.  I wouldn't touch one hair of his goddam little head.  I love the little son-of-a- bitch. JACK laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd do anything for him.  Any fucking thing for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That damn bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as I live she'll never let me forget what happened! He looks cam.L then cam.R -- throwing his hands out and sighing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did hurt him once, okay?  It was an accident, complete unintentional. It could have happened to anybody. He raps on counter with hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it was three goddam years ago. The little fucker had thrown all my papers all over the floor.  All I tried to do was to pull him up.  A momentary loss of muscular coordination.  I mean... A few extra foot pounds of energy, per second... per second. JACK gestures with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY, sobbing, runs forward along corridor.  CAMERA TRAC BACK with her and PANS L-R into Ballroom.  She runs away JACK sitting at bat in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jack! (sobs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK sitting back to camera at bar.  WENDY enters cam.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OFF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, (IN SHOT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, there's someone else in the hotel with us.  There's a crazy woman in one of the rooms.  She tried to strangle Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your fucking mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY over JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's the truth, really.  I swear it.  Danny told me.  He went up into one of the bedrooms, the door was open, and he saw this crazy woman in the bath-tub.  She tried to strangle him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which room was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montage of shots on T.V. Set for program "NEWSWATCH."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Channel 10 in Miami, this is Newswatch - with Glen Rinker and Bishop, and the award winning Newswatch team. CAMERA TRACKS BACK to reveal T.V. Set.  HALLORAN's bare f and legs on bed in f.g.  Shot of GLEN RINKER on T.V. Set with superimposed title:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening.  I'm Glen Rinker Newswatch 10.  While Miami continues to swelter in a record winter heatwave bringing temperatures to the mid and upper nineties, the Central and Rocky Mountain States are buried in snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Colorado ten inches of snow has fallen in just a few hours tonight. Travel in the Rockies is almost impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. HALLORAN - CAMERA TRACKS BACK to reveal him lying bed, watching T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airports are shut down stranding thousands of passengers.  Highways are blocked by snowdrifts.  Railroad tracks are frozen.  Officials in Colorado tell Newswatch at least three people have been killed by exposure to freezing winds.  The Governor of Colorado is expected tomorrow to declare a weather emergency.  The National Guard might be called out to clear streets and roads.  Weather forecasters predict more snow and heavy winds tonight and tomorrow, with temperatures dropping well below zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. HALLORAN's feet and legs on beg in f.g.  GLEN RINKER T.V. Set at foot of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back here in South Florida, we've got just the opposite problem; the heat and humidity are supposed to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. HALLORAN lying on pillows.  CAMERA TRACKS IN to C.S. his face, as he reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Local beaches should be jammed. Our weather expert Walter Cronice will have the local forecast later on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMMENTATOR continues inaudibly in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open door of Room 237.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY, his head shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantlepiece and fireplace.  CAMERA PANS R-L across room t open door.  Then TRACKS FORWARD through doorway to slight open door of bathroom.  CAMERA STOPS TRACKING.  Door swin open to reveal YOUNG LADY seated in bath behind curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. YOUNG LADY seated in bath behind curtain.  She draws curtain aside with hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK - he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. YOUNG LADY stands up in bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. YOUNG LADY steps out of bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK - he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. YOUNG LADY walks forward from bath and stops in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK - he moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK moves forward to YOUNG LADY - she puts her arms round his neck.  He puts his arms round her and they kiss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK over YOUNG LADY as they kiss.  He opens his e and reacts.  He pulls back from YOUNG LADY - CAMERA PANS onto mirror.  JACK & WOMAN reflected in it.  He sees she is covered with scars.  He takes his arms away from her - she starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY - he is shaking his head.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELDERLY WOMAN lying in water in bath.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK shaking his head as he backs out of bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Naked ELDERLY WOMAN laughing as she walks forward wi outstretched arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY shaking his head.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naked ELDERLY WOMAN lying in water in bath.  WOMAN LAUGHI OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK backs down steps into living room - WOMAN LAUGH OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Naked ELDERLY WOMAN laughing, as she walks forward w outstretched arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY shaking his head.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naked ELDERLY WOMAN lying in water in bath.  She starts t sit up.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK backs out of Room 237 into corridor.  He closes the door and locks it - then backs away along corridor.  He exits cam.L.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN telephone up to ear.  He dials number, then pick up phone and walks R-L to window.  He turns and walks bac L-R.  He puts phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are sorry your call cannot be completed as dialed.  If you need assistance, please call the operator. He puts telephone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY moves R-L in b.g. sobbing.  KNOCK ON DOOR OFF.  She reacts and runs forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's me. She moves R-L.  CAMERA PANS with her down steps to front door.  CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank God! WENDY takes chain off door and opens it.  JACK enters apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothing at all. JACK closes front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see one goddam thing. JACK & WENDY walks forward and move up steps to DANNY bedroom.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went into the room Danny said - to 237?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't see anything at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely nothing.  How is he? JACK moves R-L and looks into darkened bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. JACK closes bedroom door and turns to WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he'll be himself again in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move L-R into Living Room.  CAMERA PANS with them an TRACKS after them across room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, are you sure it was the right room?  I mean, maybe Danny made a mistake? WENDY & JACK move into their bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must have gone into that room - the door was open and the lights were on. WENDY sits on bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I just don't understand. JACK sits down on bed beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. WENDY sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what about those bruises on his neck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK over WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody did that to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he did it to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. WENDY shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No, that's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK over WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy, once you rule out his version of what happened, there is no other explanation - is there? It wouldn't be that different from the episode that he had before we came up here, would it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY lying awake on his bed.  CAMERA TRACKS IN on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, whatever the explanation is,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Low Angle Door with word "MURDER" written backwards across it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. DANNY lying awake on his bed.  CAMERA TRACKS IN on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we have to get Danny out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK over WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean just leave the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY with his mouth wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood gushing forward from lifts and surging up into came lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK over WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is so fucking typical of you to create a problem like this when I finally have a chance to accomplish something.  When I'm really into my work.  I could really write my own ticket if I went back to Boulder now, couldn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY & JACK sitting on bed - JACK stands up and to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shovellings out driveways, work in a car wash - any of that appeal to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy, I have let you fuck up my life so far, but I'm not going to let you fuck this up! He starts to move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.L.S. JACK walks forward from WENDY, sitting on bed.  He crosses living room and CAMERA PANS R-L with him to steps leading to front door.  He walks away down steps, opens front door and walks away along corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY sitting on bed, starts to cry.  She leans forw and buries her face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK moves forward in kitchen.  He sweeps coffee pot off table onto floor.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK before him.  He kic coffee pots on floor, then sweeps rings off stove onto fl He kicks rings as he leaves kitchen, moving into corridor CAMERA TRACKS BACK before him.  He stops and looks ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty corridor.  Balloons and streamers strewn about. CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN standing, phone up to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening.  Forest Service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallo.  My name's Dick Halloran. I'm the Head Chef up at the Overlook Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Halloran.  What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I've been trying to make an urgent phone call up there, He picks up phone and walks R-L to window.  CAMERA PANS w him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but the operator said that the phone lines are down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANGER sitting at radio with phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm afraid a lot of lines around here are down, due to the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN, phone to ear, at window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look sir, I hate to put you to any trouble, but there's a family up there all by themselves with a young kid, and with this storm and everything. HALLORAN moves L-R.  CAMERA TRACKS with him.  He puts pho on table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd sure appreciate it if you'd give them a call on your radio just to see if everything is okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANGER sitting at radio, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be glad to do that, sir.  Oh why don't you call me back in about eh twenty minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much.  I'll do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANGER puts phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR & BALLROOM - M.L.S. JACK walks forward along corridor to Ballroom.  He turns into Ballroom - CAMERA TRACKS with him revealing crowded Ballroom.  MAITRE D standing at entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. JACK moves L-R across crowded Ballroom - CAMERA TRACKS wi him to LLOYD serving behind bar.  JACK sits at bar.  LLOY moves to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Lloyd.  I've been away.  Now I'm back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening Mr. Torrance. LLOYD puts dishes of olives and peanuts on bar before JAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to be back, Lloyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll it be, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hair of the dog that big me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bourbon on the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll do her. JACK takes handful of peanuts and empties them into his mouth.  LLOYD puts ice into glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. LLOYD preparing drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  LLOYD pouring drink.  JACK takes o his wallet, takes out note and holds it out to LLOYD.  LL holds up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No charge to you, Mr. Torrance. JACK looks down at note and up to LLOYD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your money's no good here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  JACK looks down at his note then u at LLOYD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orders from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  JACK puts note back into his walle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orders from the house. He puts wallet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up, Mr. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  JACK tucking wallet into his hip pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the kind of man likes to know who's buying their drinks, Lloyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a matter that concerns you, Mr. Torrance - at least not at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  JACK smiles and picks up his drink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you say, Lloyd.  Anything you say. JACK turns away from bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.L.S. JACK moves away from bar.  He dances forward to center of room - CAMERA TRACKS after him.  WOMAN enters cam.R.f.g. and walks away.  WAITER (GRADY), carrying tray drinks, walks forward from b.g.  He bumps into WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! GRADY staggers forward, colliding with JACK and spilling drinks down front of JACK's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear, oh dear.  I'm so sorry, sir.  Oh! He puts down tray and takes advocaat glass from JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear oh dear... I've made an awful mess of your jacket, sir. GRADY puts glass on tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh eh that's all right.  I've got plenty of jackets. GRADY mops JACK's jacket with his serviette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it's advocaat sir.  It tends to stain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Advocaat is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.  Look um... I think the best thing is to come along to the gentlemen's room, sir, and eh... GRADY bends down and picks up his tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we'll get some water to it, sir. JACK & GRADY start to walk away to the Gentlemen's. TRACKS after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks as though you might have got a spot of it on yourself there, Jeevesy old boy. JACK pats GRADY on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter, sir.  You're the important one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awfully nice of you to say.  Of course I intend to change my jacket this evening before the fish and goose soiree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK & GRADY enter Gentlemen's Toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very wise, sir.  Very wise. JACK exits cam.R behind door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, I'll just, eh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men's toilet.  JACK moves in from cam.L.b.g.  He holds do open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
