dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.  Thank you. GRADY walks forward and puts his tray down on basins cam. JACK walks forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's see if we can improve this with a little water, sir. GRADY soaks his serviette under tap.  JACK puts glass dow cam.L and turns to GRADY cam.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, I'll just set my bourbon and advocaat down right there. JACK laughs.  GRADY starts to sponge JACK with serviette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't keep you a moment, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. GRADY sponges JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they call you around here, Jeevesy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady, sir.  Delbert Grady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over GRADY.  GRADY sponging JACK's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delbert Grady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, sir. GRADY sponges JACK's trousers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, Mr. Grady... JACK clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: haven't I seen you somewhere before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why no, sir.  I don't believe so. GRADY turns cam.L to basins to rinse serviette under tap. He turns back to JACK and sponges his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ha, it's coming off now, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh... Mr. Grady... weren't you once the caretaker here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why no, sir.  I don't believe so. GRADY sponges JACK's trousers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You er a married man, are you, Mr. Grady? GRADY sponges JACK's jacket sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  I have a wife and eh two daughters, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, er... where are they now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they're somewhere around.  I'm not quite sure at the moment, sir. JACK takes serviette away from GRADY and wipes his hand w it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Grady, you were the caretaker here.  I recognize you.  I saw your picture in the newspapers.  You eh... chopped your wife and daughters up into little bits, and eh... and you blew your brains out. JACK throws serviette into basin cam.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.L.S. GRADY over JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's strange, sir.  I don't have any recollection of that at all. Mr. Grady, you were the caretaker here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK over GRADY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to differ with you, sir, but you are the caretaker.  You have always been the caretaker, I should know, sir.  I've always been here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know, Mr. Torrance, that your son... is attempting to bring an outside party into this situation? Did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK.  He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is, Mr. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nigger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nigger cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son has a very great talent. I don't think you are aware how great it is, but he is attempting to use that very talent against your will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he is a very willful boy. JACK smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, he is, Mr. Torrance.  A very willful boy.  A rather naughty boy, if I may be so bold, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK.  He looks about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his mother. JACK looks about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She eh... interferes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps they need a good talking to, if you don't mind my saying so. Perhaps a bit more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girls, sir, they didn't care for the Overlook at first.  One of them actually stole a packet of matches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and tried to burn it down.  But I corrected them, sir.  And when my wife tried to prevent me from doing my duty I corrected her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY, crying and holding cigarette, walks R-L from Livin Room into Bedroom.  CAMERA PANS with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have the Snowcat.  If the weather breaks, we might just be able to get down the mountain in that. WENDY turns and walks L-R back into LIVING ROOM - CAMERA TRACKS IN and PANS with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could call the Forest Rangers first and then tell them that we're coming so that they could start searching for us, in case we didn't make it. WENDY turns and walks R-L into Bedroom - CAMERA PANS with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Jack won't come with us, we'll just have to tell him that we are going by ourselves.  That's all there is to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Rum.  Red Rum. WENDY reacts and turns to cam.R.  She runs away to DANNY' bedroom door in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Rum.  Red Rum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY opens door and stands in doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Rum.  Red Rum.  Red Rum. WENDY moves R-L from door.  CAMERA PANS with her and TRAC BACK to reveal DANNY sitting up in bed.  WENDY sits besid him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Rum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny... what's the matter, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Rum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you having a bad dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. DANNY over WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny?  Hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny's not here, Mrs. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. WENDY over DANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, hon, wake up.  You just had a bad dream.  Everything's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. DANNY over WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny can't wake up, Mrs. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. WENDY over DANNY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, wake up!  Come on, right now,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. DANNY over WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny's gone away, Mrs. Torrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. WENDY over DANNY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny... She leans forward and puts her arm round him.  She stroke his hair.

dialogues.text: JACK walking L-R past reception desk.  CAMERA TRACKS with him to office.  He goes in and switches on lights.

dialogues.text: This is KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  Are you receiving me?  This is KDK 1 calling KDK 12. KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  Do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  KDK 1  calling KDK 12.  Are you receiving me?

dialogues.text: M.S. JACK looking down at radio set.  He tries to take th cover off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  Do you read me? JACK unscrews back of set and lifts cover off radio.  He drops it on floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  KDK 1 calling KDK 12. He reaches out to the set with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. JACK's hand touches component in set.  He pulls it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you recei... He pulls two more components out of set.  He rattles them his hand, then moves out cam.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening.  Forest Service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallo, this is Dick Halloran again. I called a while ago about the folks at the Overlook Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANGER sitting at radio, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.  We tried to contract them several times by radio, but they didn't answer. MAN enters from cam.R.f.g. and walks away to b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, maybe they've got their radio turned off or they're in a place where they can't hear it.  If you like me to, I'd be glad to try them again later on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's very nice of you.  I'll call you back later.  Bye. He walks L-R.  CAMERA TRACKS & PANS with him.  He put down on receiver, and puts his hand up to his head.

dialogues.text: Superimposition: 8 a.m.

dialogues.text: HALLORAN sitting in seat.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK to reveal other passengers in their seats.  HALLORAN turns in his s and looks cam.L.  STEWARDESS enters from cam.L and stops beside HALLORAN.

dialogues.text: Pardon me, miss.  What time will we get to Denver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're due to arrive at 8:20, sir.

dialogues.text: Thank you very much. STEWARDESS walks out cam.R.  HALLORAN looks at his wristw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking.

dialogues.text: HALLORAN at telephone booth, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Larry.  This is Dick, Dick Halloran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DURKIN, phone to ear, behind counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick, how are you doing?  How's the weather down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not in Florida, Larry.  I'm calling from Stapleton Airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DURKIN, phone to ear, leaning on counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just got in from Miami, and I've got to get up to the Overlook today.  What's the weather like up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DURKIN, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the snow ploughs are keeping things moving in town, but the mountain roads are completely blocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means I'm going to need a snowcat to get up there, Larry. Can you fix me up with one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DURKIN, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the big deal about getting up there today, especially in this kind of weather?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, just between you and me, we've got a very serious problem with the people who are taking care of the place.  They've turned out to be completely unreliable assholes. Ullman phoned me last night, and I'm supposed to go up there and find out if they have to be replaced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DURKIN, phone to ear, looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long is it going to take you to get up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh about five hours.  I'm gonna rent a car here at the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DURKIN, phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Dick - I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thanks a lot, Larry.  I really appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DURKIN phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right.  Drive carefully. He puts phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN's car moving forward along snow covered road. CAMERA TRACKS BACK with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good morning to you, Hal and Charlie on Radio 63, KHOW Denver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLORAN sitting behind wheel as he drives along road L-R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and, Charlie, we have what you call your bad day out there.  What you call your heavy snow, snowing hard throughout the eh Denver metro area. Many of the mountain passes - Wolf Creek, and Red Mountain passes are already closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Shooting from behind HALLORAN through windscreen as drives along road, passing overturned truck cam.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and the chain law is in effect right now at the Eisenhower Tunnel. I guess as we've just heard from the news forecast, Charlie, a few of the flights are still landing out at Stapleton International Airport, and, with these early storms like this, I guess the entire airport will probably be closed within the hour.  Yeah, they're just not prepared.  The storm will continue throughout the day, and the national weather service... has declared a stopmans and travelers advisory... for all areas outlying the Denver metro region - get the cows in the barn. There you go.  Many businesses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY & WENDY sitting at table watching T.V. Set cam. WENDY inhales cigarette and looks at her watch.  She puts cigarette out cam.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hon, WENDY strokes his hair, then takes hold of his chin and turns his face to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...listen to me for a minute, will you, hon? She lowers her hand from his chin and strokes his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just going to go and talk to Daddy for a few minutes and I'll be right back.  I want you to just stay here and watch your cartoons, okay? She strokes his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY holds up his forefinger and wiggles it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mrs. Torrance. WENDY kisses DANNY's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Now I'll be back in just about five minutes.  I'm gonna lock the door behind me. She kisses his head and strokes his hair - then stands up and walks away to door.  She stops and picks up a basebal bat from cam.R.  She walks away through open doorway, and exits cam.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY, carrying baseball bat, walks away into Lounge.  As she goes, she turns and looks about her - CAMERA TRACKS after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...? She looks about and then moves L-R past table, with his typewriter on it.  She walks L-R behind pillar and appear again on the other side.  CAMERA TRACKS with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...? WENDY stops and looks about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.L.S. WENDY, holding bat, in f.g.  She turns and walks a to JACK's typewriter on table in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Low Angle - JACK's typewriter in f.g.  WENDY moves forward into shot.  She looks down at sheet of paper in typewriter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. Sheet of paper in typewriter with repetition of li on it, reading: "ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheet of paper is turned up, showing repetition of line. Again sheet of paper is turned up showing repetition of l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Low Angle - WENDY looking down at sheet of paper in typewriter.  She looks cam.R - then moves to cam.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Sheets of paper, filling cardboard box.  CAMERA TRAC IN on top sheet, showing repetition of the line "ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY." filling sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Low Angle WENDY looking down at box of paper in f.g. She holds up top sheet and looks at it - then puts it dow in box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.C.S. Sheets of paper filling box.  WENDY's hand enters cam.L.f.g.  She flicks through sheets of paper and sees t are all filled with repetition of line: "ALL WORK AND NO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Low Angle - WENDY flicking through sheets of paper i box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. Pillar.  CAMERA TRACKS R-L revealing WENDY, back to camera, looking through sheets of paper in box on table i M.L.S.  JACK enters cam.R.f.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like it? WENDY SCREAMS and turns round to face JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like it? JACK moves away towards table.  WENDY walks R-L along tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK moves forward.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing down here? He stops by chair and puts his hand on back of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY holding bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just eh... wanted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK - hand on back of chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to talk to you. JACK moves R-L to table.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Let's talk. JACK flicks through sheets of paper in box - then looks towards WENDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY holding bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't really remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't remember. JACK moves forward L-R.  CAMERA PANS with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY, holding bat, moves L-R.  CAMERA PANS with her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY sitting at table.  CAMERA TRACKS IN on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was about Danny.  Maybe it was about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood clear from camera lens revealing furniture floating about on river of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should discuss Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low Angle Door with word "MURDER" scrawled in reverse on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furniture floating on river of blood towards camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... we should discuss what should be done with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should be done with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY holding bat gives nervous laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK moves forward R-L - CAMERA PANS & TRACKS BA him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's true.  I think you have some very definite ideas about what should be done with Danny... and I'd like to know what they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY holding bat moves back R-L.  CAMERA PANS with She weeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I... I think maybe he should be taken to a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think maybe he should be taken to a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you think maybe he should be taken to a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY holding bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY holding bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK moves forward - CAMERA TRACKS BACK before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe his health might be at stake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY holding bat moves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ye...yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK moves forward.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are concerned about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY holding bat moves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. JACK points to himself as he moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And are you concerned about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.S. WENDY holding bat moves backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
